public final void onBindLocalBitmap(DownloadInstructions.ViewableView view,

Description copied from interface: BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions
When a local bitmap usage has been specified, is responsible for binding the view with that local bitmap.

It is ensured that this method will be run from the UI thread.

Specified by:
onBindLocalBitmap in interface BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions<DownloadInstructions.BitmapableBitmap,DownloadInstructions.ViewableView>

                                        java.lang.String bitmapUid,
                                        java.lang.Object imageSpecs)
Description copied from interface: BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions
When a temporary bitmap usage has been specified, is responsible for binding the view with that temporary bitmap.

The method will be invoked even with a bitmapUid set to null.

It is ensured that this method will be run from the UI thread.

Specified by:
onBindTemporaryBitmap in interface BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions<DownloadInstructions.BitmapableBitmap,DownloadInstructions.ViewableView>

onBitmapReady

public final void onBitmapReady(boolean allright,
                                DownloadInstructions.ViewableView view,
                                DownloadInstructions.BitmapableBitmap bitmap,
                                java.lang.String bitmapUid,
                                java.lang.Object imageSpecs)
Description copied from interface: BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions
Is invoked every time once the underlying view bitmap is either not null ready in memory (the allright parameter is set to true), or when it occurs that the bitmap could not be downloaded or is not well formed (the allright parameter is set to false).

It is NOT ensured that this method will be run from the UI thread.

Specified by:
onBitmapReady in interface BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions<DownloadInstructions.BitmapableBitmap,DownloadInstructions.ViewableView>
Parameters:
allright - indicates whether the bitmap is actually available and well formed
view - will be null if, and only if the provided View is null
bitmap - cannot be null if and only if allright is true

onBindBitmap

public final boolean onBindBitmap(boolean downloaded,
                                  DownloadInstructions.ViewableView view,
                                  DownloadInstructions.BitmapableBitmap bitmap,
                                  java.lang.String bitmapUid,
                                  java.lang.Object imageSpecs)
Description copied from interface: BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions
Is invoked once the bitmap is ready when the provided View is not null, whether it has been downloaded from Internet or retrieved from the cache.

It is ensured that this method will be run from the UI thread.

Specified by:
onBindBitmap in interface BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions<DownloadInstructions.BitmapableBitmap,DownloadInstructions.ViewableView>
Parameters:
downloaded - indicates whether the bitmap has actually been downloaded from the network or retrieved locally
bitmap - will never be null
Returns:
false if and only if the current instance did not perform the binding

onBitmapBound

public final void onBitmapBound(boolean result,
                                DownloadInstructions.ViewableView view,
                                java.lang.String bitmapUid,
                                java.lang.Object imageSpecs)
Description copied from interface: BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions
This is the last callback that will invoked during the binding process, provided it is still required that a binding should occur (i.e. that no new binding command has not been stacked for the same view in the meantime). It is invoked once the given the bitmap identifier, its specifications and either:
  • the underlying bitmap has actually been downloaded, and attached to its View,
  • or the underlying bitmap has actually been bound to its View from a local resource,
  • or, the underlying bitmap download was failure (wrong or null bitmap URL, connectivity problem).

The method will be invoked even with a bitmapUid set to null.

It is ensured that this notification will be invoked from the GUI thread.

Specified by:
onBitmapBound in interface BasisDownloadInstructions.Instructions<DownloadInstructions.BitmapableBitmap,DownloadInstructions.ViewableView>
Parameters:
result - true if and only if the bitmap has actually been downloaded and attached to its view
